citation.name: Urology
citation.title: A novel missense mutation of 5-alpha reductase type 2 gene (SRD5A2) leads to severe male pseudohermaphroditism in a Turkish family.

comment.text: Converts testosterone (T) into 5-alpha-dihydrotestosterone (DHT) and progesterone or corticosterone into their corresponding 5-alpha-3-oxosteroids. It plays a central role in sexual differentiation and androgen physiology.

kinetics.Vmax: 1.9 nmol/min/mg enzyme with testosterone as substrate with NADPH as cofactor (at pH 6.0)

comment.text: Expressed in high levels in the prostate and many other androgen-sensitive tissues.
Individuals with Thr-49 have an increased risk of prostate cancer (PubMed:10501358). The enzyme with Thr-49 has a higher in vitro V(max) than the Ala-49 enzyme (PubMed:10501358).

disease.name: Pseudovaginal perineoscrotal hypospadias
disease.description: A form of male pseudohermaphroditism in which 46,XY males show ambiguous genitalia at birth, including perineal hypospadias and a blind perineal pouch, and develop masculinization at puberty. The name of the disorder stems from the finding of a blind-ending perineal opening resembling a vagina and a severely hypospadiac penis with the urethra opening onto the perineum.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the steroid 5-alpha reductase family.

property.value: 46,XY disorder of sex development due to 5-alpha-reductase 2 deficiency

feature.description: No effect on affinity for testosterone; no effect on affinity for NADPH; no effect on Vmax.
Increased affinity for testosterone; increased affinity for NADPH; decreased Vmax.
